fstplyr
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Impementing a dplyr backend from scratch

Open a directory with .fst files as data source

Create a data source to access all .fst files in a directory with dplyr verbs.

src_fst(path)

Arguments

path

An existing directory

Examples

path <- tempfile()
dir.create(path)
fst::write_fst(iris, file.path(path, "iris.fst"))
fst::write_fst(mtcars, file.path(path, "mtcars"))

src <- src_fst(path)
src
#> src:  fst files in /tmp/Rtmp564P9o/file4a8e51206d91
#> tbls: iris, mtcars
tbl(src, "mtcars")
#> # A tibble: 32 x 11
#>      mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb
